review.reviewBody: Well built but not comfortable. The toe box is too tight and shoe does not have any cushion to speaker of.
review.name: Well built but not comfortable

review.reviewBody:
8.5 was too tight
9s are a lil loose
So we will see how they break in....
Probably should have kept 8.5 and just broke them in ?? But they were tight...
review.name: New Shoes

review.reviewBody: I purchased these as a lightweight backpacking shoe that has some technical strengths and maybe a little more stability/agility than a trail running shoe for that goal.  The sizing length was accurate in my opinion, and might be a touch on the narrow side.  I tried on a half dozen shoes, and landed on these.  I’m a size 13.  Looking forward to hitting the trail with them!  I haven’t used them much so can’t report on performance quite yet.
review.name: Fastpacking Shoe

review.reviewBody:
I live in the Adirondack Mountains and my job requires me to be walking outside all day in any weather condition. My last pair of hiking shoes didn’t hold up that well last year so figured I’d try something new and bought a pair of these. I’ve had them for about 5 months now and I’m thoroughly impressed with them. 

They’ve held up really strong compared to other hiking shoes where they lost their waterproofing, stretched out too much, ripped, etc., but not these! They’re light, breathable, sturdy, and comfortable. 

I didn’t go up half a size when I bought them so I was a little nervous about how tight they’d be from what reviews said and how they felt when I first wore them, but after breaking them in they fit perfectly. Compared to other brands they are a snug fit, however that’s the point of good hiking shoes. You don’t want too much room for your feet to be wiggling and sliding in. 

Honestly, I feel a little guilty just using them for work because of how nice they are for mountainous terrain, I mean the treads on them literally look like cleats. I don’t think I’ll need to buy another set of hiking shoes any time soon while I have these since they show no signs of getting worn out!
review.name: Took a chance and very impressed

review.reviewBody: I am in my feet all day. This is the only shoe I can keep on all day li g.
review.name: All day shoe

review.reviewBody: The laces on one shoe are way longer than the other. Other than that they are pretty awesome.

I walk anywhere from 2-20+ miles a day across varying terrains. .  I have probably put around 200-300 miles on these since I've had them and they still look brand new! 

Grip is solid wet or dry. Super comfortable even after prolonged hours. Fit is great and true to size. Have absolutely zero negatives on this product so far!
review.name: Can't go wrong with Salewa!

review.reviewBody: I bought these two months ago and the sole is already wearing down, as well as the (mesh?) siding is tearing. I wore these shoes for everyday wear and some light hiking for the first two months and haven’t worn them since given the wear.  They look good but not sure they would hold up as every day hikers.
review.name: All hat and no cowboy

review.reviewBody: After Salomon was bought out by a Chinese owned firm, I sought out to find a good replacement for hiking  shoes and these exceed the qualify and comfort of the Solomon's!
review.name: The Best So Far

review.reviewBody: I honestly don't love them. I find it to be quite heavy for a "speed hiking" shoe and bit more stiff then I would like; And hot... so very hot. The Ultra Flex 2 MID were amazing and the benchmark I held these up to. The quality and build are solid however. In about 2 weeks: 65 miles and +10k vert in Washington and California.
review.name: Solid not Perfect

name: Pedroc PTX Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Incredibly warm and super lightweight!
Great bag! Not a huge fan of the partial front zip. (Kinda hard to get into and out of)
review.name: Marmot Bantamweight 15° bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I cannot wait to take this bag on the Arizona Trail this year. 900 fill goose down. I'm sorry but I am not a "quilt guy". I enjoy the mummy shape. It is my favorite bag.
review.name: This bag is assume.

review.reviewBody: Cozy and warm. No room if you want to bring in your boot liners. Pretty tight for a big guy (across the shoulders) and similarly tough to get into the bag with the short zipper. Beautiful bag and super compressible.
review.name: Cozy

review.reviewBody: The Bantamweight bag fits a wide range of temperatures and conditions. Its a very lightweight and compact performance sleeping bag. Ive used this for multi-day alpine routes and camping in a tent. Temperatures ranged from 0 degrees to 40 degrees F. I use this bag a lot for travel to save space and weight. For very low temperatures (while climbing a big mountain for instance), I wear a jacket while sleeping. Attached is a gear testing video of the Bantamweight with an adjustable footbox. Though not included in the production model, that particular feature is included in other marmot bags.
review.name: Premium Bag for Wide Range of Activities

name: Bantamweight 15 Sleeping Bag: 15F Down

review.reviewBody: Mostly good. I’ve bopped myself a few times with this on, and I’ve dropped it onto the pavement in the parking lot by accident 2 or 3 times, and it shows no signs of damage. The vents are nice to get some extra circulation and cool things down a bit. The ear flaps are a bit too tight, I have speakers in my flaps and they tend to start chafing my ears after more than 2 hours, so I have to fiddle with the flaps a bit to get them in a position that doesn’t hurt. The boa on the back is a bit flimsy, and it doesn’t hold as reliably as I would like. Overall I’m happy with this helmet, but it could be improved with a few tweaks.
review.name: Mostly good

review.reviewBody:
Measured the circumference of my head twice, ordered based on information provided with 2 cm to spare.  Of course it is too tight. International shipping cost $100.  To return and get an exchange will require me to pay a total of $300 in shipping alone, wiping out any savings from the sale price. 4 different Backcountry customer “service” officers giving me the same unhelpful “advice”.

I have been a Backcountry customer since they started but I have had it.  I am done.  Taking the tens of thousands I spend on outdoors equipment every year, elsewhere.
review.name: Sizing is rubbish

review.reviewBody:
Misleading description! Size guide is way off!!!!

I have been using a ski helmet for 20 years (same size in all that time). My head size has not changed. My hair is high and tight. I used the size guide provided by sweet protection in order to purchase their helmet. 
Well just received my helmet. Sorry to say it fits my 13 year old daughter but not me. Not even close!!!
Emailed customer service (if you can call it that). They will NOT make this right. They will not exchange the helmet. They will not accept a return either. 
I will never make the mistake of purchasing another Sweet Protection product ever again!
Waste of money!

Hat size 7 1/4 or 22 5/8 which is right in the middle of the size purchased.
review.name: Misleading and horrible customer service

review.reviewBody: Nice helmet . The magnetic chin buckles works great. The ear pads are comfortable and have space for audio if you’re into that. The lack of a brim is important to me because I like to pop my goggles up when I’m in line if it’s not to sunny. The adjuster for fit works well . I have Anon M4 goggles and there is no gap. Usually I wear a large but these helmets run a little small so I ordered the L-XL and it fits perfectly with a balaclava. The lack of a huge logo on it is also nice. Didn’t get a goat sticker but I can’t really knock off a star for that.
review.name: Super light

name: Grimnir 2Vi Mips Helmet

description: Buy the Black Diamond HiLight Tent: 2-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: HiLight Tent: 2-Person 4-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond HiLight Tent: 2-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have only tested this once on a winter camping in temps in high 20s, no wind, no rain or snow and this is my impression:
1- tent feels very light for a 4 season tent which makes the backpacking more fun. 2- It is very easy and very very fast to set up (on a flat unfrozen dirt ground). 2- it is a single wall tent with poles going inside which means u have to open the door completely to set the tent up which means if it is raining when ure setting it up, the inside of the tent will definitely get wet. 3- I had the half moon ventilation completely open (just the mesh was zipped), the main door was one half open (from the floor up to the top on the side that my head was), and in the morning water from condensation was dripping on my face and my sleeping bag was wet to the touch. not sure how or if I could have reduced the condensation.
review.name: I had issues with condensation

review.reviewBody: I had this tent shipped to Mexico where I live. It's stood up to everything on Pico de Orizaba (3rd highest mountain in North America) and Iztaccíhuatl and Nevado de Toluca, Malinche etc. Wind, snow, rain, sun, frigid, altitude camps - the whole lot. Light enough to carry at high altitudes as well and with the weight and size no problem in the pack. Love it.
review.name: Love this tent, perfect for one person - good for two but a squeeze with the one door.

review.reviewBody: 2.5 years of abuse and here are my thoughts. I have plenty of tents, and bought this for the specific reasons of living in the desert sw and getting tired of tents filling with sand, and rain flies flapping all night during wind storms, so I got a few single walls, including this 2 person which I use as a solo tent. I like that I can close this thing up and know my sleep kit, clothes, etc, won't be caked in sand when the wind pipes up. Perfect for Powell, river, and moto trips. Even though it's basically a two pole, it has the strength of a three pole tent, and with no fly it's a quite night even in howling winds, owing in part to the internal poles. Speaking of, it's definitely more awkward to set up, especially the first 4-5 times, but worth the compromise for specialty use. The best comfort feature is the full length side door. It's a true luxury to sit in my tent, with legs outside, and change, make coffee, all with a panoramic view. I don't think I would want a single wall 4 season without this. Think French door compared to a little mouse hole. The huge door also makes it easy to shove my ultralight cot into. As far as durability goes, this thing has survived being blown 500' out in Lake Powell, and since the door and window were zipped, it was floating waiting for boat rescue. Not even a bent pole, and my stuff was mostly dry inside. That said, the fabric is thin, as it's a very light tent, and since it's single wall, you have to be careful. It takes a patch very well, as I've put several holes in it (due to rough use). Another benefit is the small pack size, and short pole pack length. Can easily fit in a pannier on bike, in any size dry duffel, etc. It's an advanced design offering a number of unique design and use elements. Love it.
review.name: Hard User

review.reviewBody: I got this tent with what appears to be defective fabric. When it was brand new there were parts of the blue fabric that were clear, like the blue dye was worn off or something. People commented on it but I ignored it but now where the fabric is translucent it’s disintegrating. Holes are forming that I have to patch. Again not a big deal to patch a tent every now and again but the holes are growing and soon the tent will be useless. Poor quality.
review.name: Defective

review.reviewBody:
I was missing a quiver in my tent collection and this tent has fit the bill. I have my lightweight backpacking summer tent and I have my burly 3-person mountaineering tent, but that tent is almost 11 lbs so it is not pleasant to carry. I needed a quality light weight, single wall, four season capable tent and after looking around I settled on this one. I have owned this tent for a little over a year now and I have put it through quite a lot and it is still handling things well. I really enjoy the modular design of tent + vestibule. When I am solo camping and want the weatherproof security of this tent I can skip the vestibule as there is still plenty of space for all of my gear inside. When I switch to using it in two person mode, I simply bring the vestibule for a lot of added space that is protected from the weather. I have used this tent in Colorado monsoons, Utah desert trips, winter snow camping, and high peaks in Peru and it was bomb proof and comfortable in every situation. I even had an Argentinian guy in Peru offer to buy it off me because he wanted one of these tents and was having trouble getting one in South America. 

I knocked one star off because I think it could be a couple inches longer as it feels a bit short (I am 5' 10") and I would prefer that it didn't taper at the bottom and instead kept the same overall width. I am sure this saves a couple ounces, but I would rather have a little extra room, especially for winter camping. Also, while this thing was a beast during a recent trip in Colorado during the monsoon I did find a small flaw in the design. During a sustained rain storm you have to completely close the storm door or water will drip in even though there is an awning. I finally figured out the rain was soaking the nylon connection points for the vestibule and wicking through the tent fabric and dripping onto the mesh and into the tent if the storm door layer was not completely closed. Not too much of a big deal, but it does cut down on your ventilation when you need it most. There is no problem with leaking from the window side. 

Regardless of the small flaws I listed above , I love this tent and would recommend it to those looking for a bomb proof, lightweight, single wall, 4 season tent that can take a ton of abuse.
review.name: Bomb Proof 4-Season Tent

review.reviewBody:
Got to break in my Hilight on a trip to the 3-Sisters wilderness over Memorial day weekend and it performed great. It's super lightweight - between the tent, poles, stakes, and ground cloth, I was looking at about 3.15lbs, which is about half the weight of my other 4-season tent. Temps varied between a high of about 65 and a low of about 25. The huge mesh door/window were great for ventilation, and we had no issues with condensation overnight even with all the windows sealed. I love the cross-pole that creates two small awnings over the door and window the tent, though I'd probably take that down in windy conditions as to not have wind catch the openings. 

I considered the FirstLight too, but since I do most of my mountaineering between April - October, the Hilight provides more comfort with the changing temps rather than the more winter-oriented FirstLight. 

Setup with two people takes about 5-10 minutes, but pitching poles inside a tent can take a bit of practice. 

With two people, it was livable, but a bit cramped. For 1-2 days it's perfectly fine, but I wouldn't particularly like to wait out a storm in it. Definitely recommend the vestibule once it comes back in stock.
review.name: Perfect for fast-and-light missions

review.reviewBody: Took this backpacking and it did really well in a cold rainy night. Ventilation was tough as it was a downpour but managed to not condensate too much
review.name: Strong against winds

review.reviewBody: I would rig this to my raft on the Grand Canyon during a February trip. I had zero problems during the rain, snow, and 50 mph winds. I had the windows open majority of the time, to stare at the stars between the canyon walls. Would’ve liked the awning attachment, but it seems to stay sold out.
review.name: Survived the epic Grand Canyon winter trip like a pro

review.reviewBody: I purchased this tent to hunt the backcountry due to its light weight. The weight of the tent is great and I thought I loved it untill camping both in the rain as well as the cold. Unless mine was flawed, anytime you slept in the rain or colder temps the amount of condensation and water leakage left myself and my gear soaking wet and miserable. With perfect weather this tent might get a better review.
review.name: Not worth the price

review.reviewBody: Used for summiting Mt. Rainier. Withstood 60mph winds (used 12in snow stakes). Only downside is it's a side entrance which can be a pain with two people, but works great.
review.name: Mountaineering

name: HiLight Tent: 2-Person 4-Season

review.reviewBody: What a guarantee! I have a problem and they offer me a credit towards a new pair!

review.reviewBody: In my opinion, Smiths are the best. Style, comfort, quality, and customer service that cannot be beat. The chromapop lenses are more colorful and clear than true life, and they look good on anyone’s face. Low light, maximal sun, and everything between are better with these on your face.
review.name: Truly the best

review.reviewBody: I’m in love with these. The metal ear pieces make for a lightweight stylish feel. The nose piece is comfortable and stays in place. I love the purple mirror and the look.
review.name: Stylish, sleek, comfy

review.reviewBody: Great design with fantastic lens Style with complete performance, it’s what you expect from top name brands and Smith always delivers
review.name: Great design with fantastic lens

review.reviewBody: Love the look and fit. They stay put when I'm biking and are so comfortable that I forget I'm wearing them. Chromapop is about as good as it gets! Vastly improves visibility and cuts glare when fishing. Everything looks so vivid and bright without the eye strain. Highly recommend!
review.name: Perfect shades

review.reviewBody: They are as fabulous as my last pair. I love these, not only do they provide great visual clarity, they are stylish, stay on while active and are just great glasses. The warranty process to replace them when my others broke was also one of the best experiences. Great product, Great people.
review.name: Love Smith sunglasses

review.reviewBody: Great glasses, a bit sad they don’t come with a hard case and a lens wipe for the price….
review.name: Great but underwhelming

review.reviewBody: I love these frames! Flattering style, but super functional. Im a fly fishing guide and look at the water all day every. These definitely protect my eyes and the chromapop makes a huge difference when spotting fish in the water.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: I wear these things everywhere! Whether it's in the mountains on a bike, hiking, climbing, or some other adventure I've never had them slip off my face or cause me an issue. They go with me in the car and recently all the way to Puerto Rico for some awesome adventures there. The only downside I have seen are 2 small blemishes in a lens. I plan on reaching out to smith about it but there has been no downside to these things. Love'em!
review.name: Awesome Glasses

review.reviewBody: Love these sunglasses. Great lenses, high quality and fashionable
review.name: Love these sunglasses. Great lenses,

review.reviewBody: After two seasons it developed a leak.  Contacted MRP customer service 4 separate times. The first time they recommended that I replace the schrader valve and if that didn’t work to contact them and they would help me figure it out or send a rebuild kit.  I didn’t have a spare valve so I went back to the original factory cap and used tokens and experienced no leaks, put the bike away for the winter and in the fall still holding pressure.  Then spring rolled around, and I was missing the ability to change the progression on the fly.  So I  replaced the valve and put it back on my bike and it didn’t fix the leak.  Contacted customer service three more times and two times they told me that someone else would contact me and no one ever did.  The last time a week ago nothing.  So good product, but if reliability is important, and longevity is important, customer service is important, then do not buy this.
review.name: Poor customer service, ok product.

review.reviewBody: when i called to get a return label, THREE TIMES i spoke with nice reps who were in the Philippines...outsourcing gets a big thumbs down from me...i WROTE three times and got the same boiler plate response that did not rectify my situation....please don't ask your customers to print their own labels and drive to the nearest Fed-x station...in rural areas that's a long haul....so, three phone calls and three emails and ZIP, nothing...the third call i reached a woman in utah who said she would ship out the correct product and i would mail back the incorrect product....really??  you can't include a return USPS mailing?  everyone has a post office nearby....really disappointed in the policy, not the people...
review.name: wrong product sent

review.reviewBody: Add these rotors to my bikes when ever I find them on sale. Great quality, easy swap and I love the look.
review.name: Shimano quality, why not?

review.reviewBody: Ice Tech pads and rotors really make a difference. My 2 piston XT brakes as well as the 4 piston Deore non-Ice Tech setup in another bike.
review.name: Ice Tech braking rules

review.reviewBody: La mejor calidad que se puede obtener al mejor precio, los m°s livianos en su categor°a, respuesta inmediata al frenar y s°per resistentes al uso constante.

review.reviewBody: Couldn't be happier with these -- Shimano makes a great product.  Running these now on both my bikes (a hardtail XC and a full suspension).   Great linear feel, quiet, and all the stopping power needed.  I've been riding on these year-round for about 18 months now and they have worked flawlessly rain or shine.   Most all of my riding is on beginner & intermediate single track with steep but short hills, although I did spend a full day last summer doing nothing but harrowing downhill runs at a bike park (fun btw!).  That gave the brakes a good workout....no issues.
review.name: Awesome Rotors

review.reviewBody: I have a 203 up front and 180 in back paired with a set of M9120 brakes and I have no complaints.
review.name: they stop my bike nice

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Pass GTX Wide Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: After a few weeks and the liberal application of a boot stretcher, it’s fair to conclude that the last on these “wide” boots isn’t up to modern standards. I love the fit of a similarly sized Altra shoe, but what Danner has done here isn’t roomy enough in the toes to count as wide in my book. Otherwise, the boot is very well built with a novel lighter-weight sole but still a welted boot design that imparts classic hiker quality.
review.name: Narrow toe box for a “wide” boot

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Pass GTX Wide Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I waited for a long time to get a pair of top end Danners and was so excited for these boots.  They made it 7 weeks before the bottom half of the sole of the boot started to pull away from rest of the sole.  Honestly, I was gutted.  These are not cheap boots, but I've bought much cheaper that have lasted much longer.  Backcountry has been good with working through the warranty issues, but could only give me store credit.  So begins the hunt for a better and longer lasting boot.
review.name: Split Sole (and Soul)

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Pass GTX Wide Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Though the boot indicates EE width, it is indeed close to a normal toe box size. In the Danner 917 Logger I wear a size 10. In the Danner EE Mountain 600 I wear a 9.5. For this boot I started with 10.5 and had to exchange for an 11. That said, overall quality and comfort right out of the box make Danner so great. The comments about the laces being cheap are accurate. Not a big deal but disappointing. Not sure how much more weight would be added to the boot with thicker laces but I would accept the trade off. If you like the style - check the boots out.
review.name: Wide feet size up

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Pass GTX Wide Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These boots (and Danner's entire Portland Select collection) are incredibly well made, and can literally last a lifetime if you treat them right. If you tromp around in these things as much as I do, innevitably the outsole of the boot will wear out before the leather in the upper does. The beatiful thing about these is that you can have them resoled by Danner! I love the unique character that the leather develops after many many uses (not to mention the custom fit), and these boots will remain as some of my favorites until I am too old to walk- at which time I will likely have them mounted/framed so they can hang in my house.
I did find these run a little big, I sized down a half size.
review.name: Wear them till you're 90

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Pass GTX Wide Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have had several pairs of Danner shoes and all have been excellent quality.  I decided to try the Mountain Pass after much internal debate...price vs quality...vs price.  Backcounty was the only company where I found the Brown color in my size.  I placed the order, boots arrive quickly and I have been wearing them everyday.   It took about 2 weeks to break in and become more supple.  However, they are great boots for everyday work.  I work in a manufacturing environment but am required to dress for business.  The boots help me accomplish that requirement.  I can wear them with khakis and not be nervous when venturing outside my office onto the manufacturing floor.
review.name: Simply put - Danner makes great shoes

name: Mountain Pass GTX Wide Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Based on some reviews I read, these shoes should have been a great fit.  I got fat feet, and my old Shimano R088 size 46 got a little too snug.  I used the True Fit guide based on my running shoes, and purchased the suggested size (Also a 46.0).  The toe box has no room at all.  It runs very small, and the fit guide should have suggested a bigger size based just on that.  I laid the insole of this shoe next to my New Balance 12 2E shoes that fit, and its noticeable that these Pearl Izumi shoes are smaller in length.  When you look for a wide shoe because your foot is wide or fat or both, you don't want a size down.  Now I have to pay for the return, after using this True Fit guide, for shoes too small for my feet.
review.name: Snug and Small Toe box

name: Summit Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Fit well. I’d like them longer to cover forearm. I use them daily for protection against sun including driving. I wear a size large. It fits well, snug, not tight. Best way to protect your hands from the sun and from fly line burns or finger cuts. All while keeping cool and dry

review.reviewBody: Excellent sun protection & the line stripping guard is just a bonus.

It's hot in texas, and the sun is crazy.  I wear these to save my hands from sun burns, but I also like the grips on them too.  They also dont seem to carry stink on them like other gloves.  Real nice stuff, a bit pricey but quality

review.reviewBody: I did not find these boots to be as good for my bunions as the Supra boa boot is.  Additionally, when these boots were buckled so that my foot was snuggly held, my feet got cold-all while indoors. Needless to say, I opted for the Supra boa and returned these.
review.name: Narrow toe box
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: I don't know who Salomon makes boots for when they get rid of the their 120 flex women's ski boot and calls their super soft 110 boots for "experts." A Salomon rep told me I don't weigh enough to ski the 120 flex and pushed me to the 110 instead. They kind of suck. Hey Salomon, women whose feet are smaller than the men's boots are capable of skiing hard too. Want to make a boot for us, or should I go back to wearing Lange?
review.name: Pillow Soft Flex

review.reviewBody: My foot measures 10” long, 100mm wide. I’m typically a 24.5 across manufacturers. I skied the 24.5 for two short shifts and had a hard time feeling anything due to the tightness that never eased up. I sized up to 25.5 and I am impressed. This boot is responsive and has a great forward flex for steeps and long shifts patrolling. If you’re an intermediate looking to advance or already an expert, this boot performs. It’s snug, but comfortable and warm. I use disposable toe warmers when it’s less than 28 degrees and still love the fit & feel of this boot. No
review.name: S PRO ALPHA W

review.reviewBody: I bought the old version of these (S/Pro 110 w) two years ago and they've probably had 60 days on them total. They now need to be replaced because the plastic has lost all stiffness and is probably flexing like a 70 flex boot. I'm not sure if that's due to the materials, the form, or my skiing, but either way it's super disappointing.
review.name: Shell softens fast!

review.reviewBody: I have nothing but praise for this boot. I skied first to last chair for 5 days straight on this boot right out of the box and they were amazing! I ski aggressively and it handled it all from steeps to bumps to knee deep fresh powder in the trees.  Hands down the most comfortable performance boot I've ever had. Extremely precise and fantastic power transfer.
review.name: Most comfortable performance boot

review.reviewBody:
"I can't speak highly enough about the Salomon S/Pro Alpha 110W boots. Simply, they rip. Salomon moved the two lower buckles back a bit in this boot and it made a huge difference; my heel actually does feel locked in place with zero movement. Merge that with its low profile design and ample toe box which keeps blood flowing to my inevitable cold toes, the S/Pro Alpha 110W fits like a glove. I ski with custom liners so I can’t speak to the fit of the Alpha’s factory liners, but the snugness and performance of the shell is unmatched. Even with custom liners and Booster straps my foot usually moves around more than I want, but not in these boots. 

The S/Pro Alpha 110W is stiff and responsive. It can take the power you put into it, and it wants you to do so; it flexes just enough when you need it and pushes back when need the support. Chase the pros down groomers and through variable conditions like a champ, and when it comes to buttery powder, this boot’s glove-like fit responds exactly how you want it to. I'm based in Lake Tahoe and mainly ski Palisades, though I was able to bring these on a Utah trip this year as well. I highly recommend this boot for any women looking for a ski boot that matches their strength and aggressive ski style."
review.name: Finally, a powerful women's boot that rips.

review.reviewBody: This boot had a great out of the box fit for my narrow foot. I would also say that the power transfer I experienced was phenomenal and I enjoyed the aggressive forward lean in the boot.
review.name: S/Pro Alpha 110 W

review.reviewBody: I was able to use this boot for most of the Spring season, and am extremely impressed with the comfort and control I felt. I usually have to tweak my boots quite a bit for my feet to not go numb after a couple hours skiing. Although the S/Pro Alpha has the ability to make endless adjustments through heat molding/stretching of plastic, I found that just after one session of cooking them, they are even more comfortable than my prior boots. I am extremely pleased with the precision and control I feel skiing these. Best boot I've had!
review.name: Comfortable and Responsive!

review.reviewBody:
I could rave for hours about the excellence of the Salomon S/Pro Alpha 110W ski boot. It's honestly the most comfortable and responsive boot I've ever skied. I have pretty sensitive feet, so getting new ski boots is a BIG DEAL for me, and I dread the break-in period. Well, let me just start with the fact that I experienced zero discomfort on DAY ONE after following proper setup instructions. It felt like I had been skiing in those boots for half a season on my first day. Just a few days in, I skied bell-to-bell on a powder day, and the same thing — pure bliss on my feet and toes, something I haven't quite experienced with any ski boot.

Now let's talk about the functionality and stiffness of the boot. I'm a pretty technical skier, so sidestepping and boot packing was a breeze in these babies, and it felt good. I felt there was the right amount of stiffness for me to lay down some turns on a groomer day and charge on a powder day. I even recommend keeping these boots on for a beer or two; that's how great they are. =)
review.name: Incredible Ski Boot

name: S/Pro Alpha 110 GW Boot - 2025 - Women's

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Syncro 20L Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Syncro 20L Hydration Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Syncro 20L Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is exactly what I wanted in a backpack. Thanks
review.name: This is exactly what I

review.reviewBody:
I mtb 3-4 time a week and hike the remaining days year round in the North East.  I have had the Syncro 12L for years and use it when ever I ride.
 I loved the pack so much I started using for short (5-10mile) summer day hikes but it was just a bit too small for longer hikes and for shoulder season and hiking the North East 115. 
I got the Syncro 20L that is perfect for longer (7-20 mile) high elevation day hikes in shoulder season. 
I've hike about 25 miles so far with the new 20L pack 
I can fit; 3L CamelBak reservoir, base layer, rain jacket, insulation layer, hat, tiny camp towel~10"x20", headlamp, micro first aid /survival kit, small back up battery pack for electronics, and plenty of space for food:sandwich,apple, snacks, half dozen energy bars, dog food/treats, dog collapsible bowl. 
The pocket design is way better than any hiking pack I've had or seen. 
The interior mesh pocket keep everything organize and easy to find when opening the pocket. The top pocket is plenty big enough for sunglasses or delicate items like small cameras. Outer mesh pockets are great for hiking poles, damp items like dog water bowl or towel if you go for a back country plunge. 
The suspension is super comfortable and air mesh helps a lot. My back still sweats if I'm hustling but you can feel the air across your back helping to continuously dry as you wear it.  
The waist belt has small stretchy pockets on the belt which are just big enough for energy bar and chap stick, compass. "Not"big enough for a smart phone. 
The incorporated rain fly is perfect too and use it often. 
Negatives:
The Black metal suspension rods on my older Snycro 12L pack are rusting.(Many years of use) I've noticed that the coating on my new Syncros 20L metal suspension rods are now silver and thicker. So hoping Osprey has corrected this issue. 
The zippers are a bit tight and loud. Not as silky sliding as on my other Osprey packs. This may be by design so they don't accidentally open when biking and they certainly do not. 
Not a fan of the Osprey hydration bladders. They always spring a pin hole leak fairly quickly and they don't warranty this. I never have this issue with CamelBak. 

My wife loved this packs design so much but the men's shoulder straps didn't work with the female form So she bought the women's version the Sylva 20L  
 As of Sept. 2024, For some very odd reason the American Osprey company is not selling the women's Sylva 20L in the United States. She had to buy it from a bike shop in Germany and have it shipped to NY. With exchange rate it ended up about the same price but did not come with the hydration reservoir. 
Backcountry should talk with Osprey and find out why they're not offering it in the U.S.
review.name: Best Day Hike Pack Ever

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a bike trip. It was the perfect size and so comfortable! It held my hydration, bike tools, rain jacks& snacks.
review.name: Best Bike Hydration Pack

review.reviewBody: I've had a couple of the smaller osprey hydration packs- talon and others models. I've never tried the airspeed system and I can say it really is worth the hype. I had to stop a couple of times on the first ride to see the if the reservoir was leaking because I had this cooling breeze across my back I had never had before. If you want a system with better cooling a ventilation this is it, stop looking and pull the trigger.  I'm just an average joe that's been an MTB rider since the 90's and I can say this is the best hydration pack I've ever owned hands down.
review.name: Back stays cool, lots water lots of room

review.reviewBody: I wanted a pack that would not only be good for biking ,but would be spacious enough for a day hike . The syncro 20 did just that and is very comfortable when fully loaded . The pack has many compartments and although it’s not a laptop bag ( not recommended for that ) I fit my 12 inch iPad Pro along with a padded sleeve into the bladder section perfectly.
review.name: Favorite pack

review.reviewBody: I own several Osprey packs. This might be my favorite. It is the perfect size for a quick day hike. Whether I want to bring along a snack, my and my spouse's jackets, etc... Or maybe just my camera and single lens. Many ways to outfit the pack. Maybe throw my iPad in it and hop on my bike and head down to a coffee shop. Pretty much anything 5min to 4 hours....this pack is it. I have a 35L that I would grab if I wanted something for 4-24 hours and then I have a true backpacking pack for a the 1+ day hikes. But this pack is now my go-to pack!!
review.name: Probably my favorite pack

review.reviewBody: I wanted a ventilated backpack for mountain biking and hiking, and this is perfect. The main compartment is spacious, and if not full can be tightened up with compression straps so things don't move around. The outer pocket lets me organize everything neatly -- first aid kit, inReach communicator, flashlight, swiss army knife, some bike tools. The side sleeves can easily fit a Sigg water bottle. And when I hike or bike in hot weather, I no longer drench my back as I used to do with my non-ventilated pack!
review.name: Great for hiking and biking

review.reviewBody: I use this pack for mountain biking, moto, and hiking. I bought this to have a larger capacity pack that will comfortably carry everything I'd need for big alpine rides and shoulder season where additional layers are needed. It doubles up as great day hiking and summit pack. Having the large capacity vertical tool storage compartment on the back rather than down low like the Raptor is a + IMO as is the narrower profile compared to the hiking packs in the line up. Easy too keep tools organized and provides extra storage when needed. Main compartment size is great for the larger bulkier items. The pack is very stable and easy to adjust when transitioning from easy riding to engaging descents. Fully loaded it is extremely comfortable. The ventilation provided by the airspeed setup is noticeable.
review.name: sleeper pack in the line up / crosses categories

name: Syncro 20L Hydration Backpack

review.reviewBody: Simple to use, yet finely adjustable. Tons better than leather for intensive hiking - at least to my experience.
review.name: Simple and effective!

review.reviewBody: This belt is completely adjustable. The buckle has a toothed clamp that can be released so that you can move it closer to the matching belt tip. Then you can either close the jaw, and let the excess flow underneath the exposed belt on your waist, or opt to cut it to size.
review.name: Classic and adjustable

review.reviewBody: Purchased the belt less than 2 years ago. The belt is NOT actually brass and there is no way to know this if you buy it in store. As of now, the finish if falling off and is getting on my skin. The belt would be amazing if it wasn't for the deceptive name, lack of information in the store, and bad brass finish
review.name: False Advertising In Store

review.reviewBody: The belt is surprisingly longer than expected and there is no place to keep the excess from flapping around.  Pretty disappointing.
review.name: Disappointing but a nice color.

review.reviewBody:
Well Packaged It Came In 
I Was Instantly Hooked On This Belt And The Brass Detailing In It Is Amazing Thank You :D
review.name: Great Belt And Brass Detail

review.reviewBody: Belt was initially too long for me but, was able to pry open the tail end of the belt and cut the belt down to my waist size plus some extra inches, then burnt the ends of the canvas belt and reapplied the tail cover. The belt is nice and firm if you would clip anything onto it but also comfortable.
review.name: Nice Belt

name: Canvas Brass Belt - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Bark Ranger Dog Bike Trailer online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very well designed. Our dog loves it and the training videos have helped us get him accustomed. Can't wait to put it to the test on a bikepacking trip.
review.name: Great Investment

review.reviewBody: Love this trailer. Very stable for my 70 lbs Airedale. He loves going with me when I go biking. He greets everyone we meet!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Everything about this stroller is amazing! I could use a cup holder when I’m walking them to get my morning coffee but that is something I can order and strap it onto handle. My dogs love it! I haul 5 dogs in it bike riding most of the time! Then it pushes very nicely for a stroller!!! We have bought 2 very high end strollers for our furry kids and this is 10 times what they are!! Changing over from bike to stroller is very simple. All the panels are convenient! My dogs don’t get hot in there either! The quality is amazing! Rain cover is perfect. We loaded our with everything you could buy almost other than kickstand and I would like that too but we make do for now. It sets up in a matter of a minute or two as well!! Excellent work making this stroller/pet trailer!!!
review.name: Everything about this stroller is

review.reviewBody:
This thing is a breeze to use and our dog loves it! Our anxious rescue hates being left alone & the Bark Ranger has made it possible for me to go on longer bike rides again. 

We eased him into it, using it first as an in-house crate for a week or two, then an outdoor crate, then as a trailer. He **did** throw up about 7 times on our first ride, but with a couple adjustments (mother riding in front instead of behind us, fewer treats thrown into the trailer), he has been fine ever since! 

We take it down to the local dog park, to restaurants, and on a couple longer rides; my hope is to eventually get back into bikepacking trips and bring him along :D

Reference for photos: Tulkas is a 50lb male standard poodle. The XL allows him to comfortably stand while riding and is the same size as his crate.
review.name: This thing is a breeze

review.reviewBody: What a well built wagon. And it really does not need suspension, really .
review.name: What a well built wagon.

review.reviewBody:
Wow, I had high hopes that the Bark Ranger would work for our two small small dogs to take them on bike and walk trips, as they are both older and not up to the long hauls like they used to be. The Bark Ranger exceeded those hopes! 

It comfortably seats both pets, at about 25lbs each, and both sit and are able to have line of sight in all directions and look very much at-ease while inside; they actually love the rides. The roll-down shades make light and sun control easy. 

The ride is absolutely smooth on all of the terrain we've encountered in both trailer and stroller configurations. It has excellent balance and is stable even when the dogs are moving or adjusting position inside. Maneuvering the cart in stroller configuration is very agile. We can handle curved sidewalks and sharp turns, and the overall lightweight build makes pushing it on to grass, dirt, and gravel a worry-free event.

The included flag and reflectors work well and I don't have any worries about traffic visibility of the cart in either mode. It attaches to an e-bike easily and securely as well. When we need to place it in the car, it collapses enough to compact into the back storage area of our mid-size suv; its easy to take on car trips!

Just an great purchase. Outstanding.
review.name: The Perfect Pet Chariot

review.reviewBody: Very durable and comfortable ride for boy. The big cushy wheels and padded liner makes the ride easier for Nelson on rough New Orleans streets. He loves it!
review.name: Upgrade for our social rider!

review.reviewBody: My 75-pound lab and I have travelled 700 miles so far in our Bark Ranger XL, most recently on a 5-day bike camping trip along the Erie Canal. We rigged a sling between the push handle and frame to carry our sleeping bag, tent, sleeping mat on Burley to keep some of the weight off the bike. This worked great. We used the rain cover at night to store items in the trailer and protect them from getting wet, this worked great as well. The only problems we've had are with the parking brake. The cable came loose from the tie wrap that secures it in-place on the inside of the trailer, easy fix. The other may have been self-imposed... The trailer rolled on a steep hill with the parking brake engaged and damaged the wheel sprockets so the pins would not engage and hold the trailer stationary. Big problem if a stop is necessary on a hill! Looks like there are replacements available so I'll repair and keep a spare on hand for the next trip. Overall, super satisfied.
review.name: Bark Ranger XL after 700 miles...

review.reviewBody: Love our Burley. Super easy to tow with our Aventon E-bikes. 100% worth the price. The quality is top.
review.name: Worth it 100%

review.reviewBody: We rents bought 2 e-bikes so we purchased 2 x-large bark rangers for our 2 border collies. There used to be plenty of room and they are very solid and high quality. Highly recommend.
review.name: Twin Burley

name: Bark Ranger Dog Bike Trailer

description: Buy the Black Diamond Evac 7 Shovel online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Evac 7 Shovel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Evac 7 Shovel online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I really like this shovel. The blade is big but the shovel itself is light. Durable, too. Does it need hoe mode? Not in an emergency situation, but it is nice for digging holes and everyday use.
review.name: Light and efficient

review.reviewBody:
As with any large shovel it moves a lot of snow quickly, but the small details add up. The curve in the handle that allows for a hoe mode makes for a great spot to hold the shovel on extended digging for snow walls or rescues. The blade makes straight and smooth snow pit walls easy (unlike some other company’s shovels). One warning, because it’s a large shovel, make sure it fits in your chosen pack. Smaller/lighter packs may come with smaller rescue gear pockets.

For expedition and professional use, this shovel is a must in the team. We brought one to Denali last season and combined with a snow saw, it became the shovel that everyone was looking for to get camp chores from cook shelter construction to building wind walls done.
review.name: The best large shovel on the market.

review.reviewBody: If you want a shovel that dogs efficiently. This is it. Whether you are a backcountry skier or a ski patroller, this shovel is gray quality. I like the comfort of the handle and how the handle extends. From finding someone in an avalanche to digging snow pits, would highly recommend.
review.name: Efficient shovel

review.reviewBody: I upgraded from my smaller BCA collapsible shovel to this big guy primarily for my upcoming Denali trip. This one worked great digging out tent platforms and a cook tent, and I spent way less time stopped over compared to my smaller shovel. Obviously it's larger and heavier, but definitely worth the tradeoff for me!
review.name: Awesome bigger shovel

review.reviewBody: Shovel is easy to pack and deploy. Great quality product.
review.name: Great Quality

review.reviewBody: Don’t love how the curved attachment point for the blade and the handle fit in my pack. However, when put together it’s an ergonomically good shape.
review.name: It’s a shovel

review.reviewBody: I got this because the Evac 9 has trouble fitting into my Scott avy bag. The Evac 7 is still big enough to move snow around quickly. D-handle and hoe mode are great features.
review.name: Great Avy Shovel

review.reviewBody: Haven't used it yet since I just got it and the season hasn't started yet. It fits perfectly into my new Dawn Patrol 25 pack which I will be using for full time ski patrol work. It seems sturdy and I especially like the ability to switch to how mode quickly. The blade volume is bigger than my other shovels=more and quicker snow removal. We're always having to dig out tower and snowmaking hydrant pads, plus we do buried transceiver drills regularly. It will definitely be put to work this upcoming 23-24 season.
review.name: Evac 7

review.reviewBody: Backed over it with the Skidoo Skandic with barely a scratch left on the shovel!
review.name: Indestructible shovel?

review.reviewBody: The Evac 7 is a well made shovel. The welded attachment point for the handle is just one example of the quality design. The shovel is light for its size and packs well. I would recommend this shovel to experts as well as those heading out to the back country for the first time.
review.name: Well Made Shovel

name: Evac 7 Shovel

review.name: Great brand, perfect fit

review.reviewBody: Nice and lightweight. Perfect for Backpacking trips with kids. And makes a great layer to keep the bugs off. It packs up small and can easily cram it in your kids backpack.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: I cherish my Teca half zip for its happy colors and perfect warmth factor… And it’s light weight makes it an easy grab and go that I keep in my tennis bag and or when I’m biking. I’ve been looking forward to when you make a kids version and it’s finally here! My son hasn’t worn his out yet but It’s going to come with us on every trip, local or abroad!
review.name: Perfect spring layer

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for my son. He actually picked it out and we came back for it because I told him I would get it for him if he still wanted it next week to delay instant gratification. He still wanted it and this is one of his favorite jackets. Like most five year old boys he does not like to have a jacket on. Fortunately, he loves this color and how light it is and it’s been perfect for the rain. We love it and he looks super cute in it. My son is really tall for his age and around 70 pounds so the medium fits perfectly and is true to size. I hope you like it as much as we do!
review.name: Light and easy jacket

review.reviewBody: I got two of these, one for each kid. Medium for my 9yo and XS for my 6yo. They haven’t worn them yet, but the jackets seem to be well made and I love the bright colors.
review.name: Great Colors

review.reviewBody:
My daughter loved the windbreaker so much when she opened it on Christmas morning. So much so that we came back to our local Cotopaxi in LA and got more gear for good to add to hers and my collections.

Thanks for all y’all do!
Best Joe K.
review.name: Great Jacket!!!!

review.reviewBody: He loves how thin it is, it protects him very well when it's windy and the big pocket is the greatest
review.name: My son loves it !!!

review.reviewBody:
cotapaxi made it right..!

I really love it.. love it so much..
review.name: Designed well..!

review.reviewBody: Everything from this company is amazing! I keep exploring new products from Cotopaxi because they are so well-made and effective.
review.name: My daughter loved it

review.reviewBody: I bought this fleece for my wife. We’ve been using Mountain Hardware products for years, and she usually wears medium. However, the last two products, including this fleece, have been smaller than usual. Now, she’s a large size (she hasn’t gained weight). This happened to me too. I used to be a men’s medium, but now I’m a large. I guess Mountain Hardware changes their sizing for newer products. The old styles, which are on sale, are the same usual size. So, be aware. I would recommend trying to order two sizes just in case.

review.reviewBody:
Works as intended, 3 stars as I would get the other version. 5 as it does do the job. 
 An external ring moves to point out amount of torque against the markings on the barrel. 

If I could go back, I would get the NANO TORQBAR X for extra $10 and here is why: 

The NANO TORQBAR X holds the bits and the torque bit and is used to apply torque and easier to transport. 

The bar edition?s bit has the Allen backing, no need to find a bit to attach it.

With this version your provided tool is best with strong magnets or the constant moving around causes bits to separate.
review.name: Skip it, get NANO TORQBAR X

hasVariant.name: Torin 7 Wide Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Altra Torin 7 Wide Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The shoes are great!! They made me want to go out & run more but sadly they get super dirty real quick( I knew they would get dirty since I got the white ones but I have to wash them weekly cause they get dirty so easily & quickly) & I have had them for less than 4 months & the sides of the soles are wearing down. I do not use them every day or anything like that but it's sad that they're giving me these small issues.
review.name: Great shoes but...

review.reviewBody: Wanted a new pair of Torin's as loved my Torin 5s. These fit very differently and don't seem to be breaking in. Will return
review.name: Not the same as previous Torin model 5

review.reviewBody: Was disappointed in this shoe! Loved my Altra trail running shoes especially for the zero drop and comfortability but I wanted a pair for road/walking adventures so I was directed to purchase these. After two weeks of wear I still had so much foot pain, it's way too tight on the sides but it was so loose around my ankle. If I had sized up it would be simply too big. No amount of breaking in was going to help the tightness. It also gave me weird hip pain too, which I've never experienced before, and it ceased once I stopped wearing the shoes. Had to return :/
review.name: Foot pain and disappointment

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes so much. I've been running in them for 4 weeks now and I have not a shin splint in sight! I typically always get shin splints and lower back pain with running. These Torins are an answered prayer!
review.name: Hello pain free running!!

review.reviewBody: I sized up 1/2 size from my usual size and found the promised land.
review.name: Great for road and treadmill runs

review.reviewBody: These are the worst of a series of bad Torin models. They hurt my feet and won't break in. They're narrow. The ankle is loose. The laces are too stretchy. I'm looking at other brands again.
review.name: Painful and narrow

review.reviewBody: I don't know who ultra thinks they're fooling, but I have gone through three pairs of Torin sneakers and have never had a problem, Until these!! The very comfortable toebox no longer exists my front toes on the outside at the top, where rubbing against the toebox and the cord at the top of the sneaker was cutting into my ankles. 20 minutes into a 40 minute workout. I had to take them off because they were killing my feet.!!
review.name: All I can say is UGH!! Altra what have you done?

review.reviewBody: Amazing shoe, but - 300km in 5 months and upper started having holes and detaching from sole on one shoe. I wear them only in dry weather, only for road running. Lone Peaks upper is indestructible.
review.name: Love them, except for the upper...

review.reviewBody: Sizing: I am normally a women's 10, in these I prefer a 10.5 Oftentimes, a 10.5 is not available, so I appreciate that half sizing. Also, if you're on your wide toe base journey, you know having a spacious toe box is part of the deal, so going up half a size sort of makes sense. I love these because they have a cushion, but a 0mm toe to heel drop. I am making my way towards a more barefoot lifestyle and these are perfect for that journey. I have had my current pair for a year and still wear them religiously- to work as a nurse, hiking, walking, practicing soccer, and to the gym for weight lifting. I also get compliments on this style of shoe. Love them!
review.name: Buying 2nd pair!

review.reviewBody: Run half size small, size up. Also the laces are way too short for those of us with wide feet. I am barely or not able to tie the shoes. Please make the laces at least 5" longer.
review.name: Great shoe except...

name: Torin 7 Wide Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: The reviews said it can be a little snug with the lining so order a size up. I did. I’m usually XS but got the S and it fits just perfectly. I am not layering up underneath, just wearing this like I would a hoodie or sweater, wearing a t shirt or long sleeve under, and I think it’s exactly what I wanted. I feel like a teddy bear. My cats give it 9 stars.
review.name: Order size up. Very warm/comfy

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. Get up To An Extra 20% OFF discount from: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody: Such a cute pullover that just does not work! With the inflexible material I literally almost got stuck in it, and this was a size up that I was drowning in while actually wearing.
review.name: Don’t waste your time!

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket- warm and windproof- great for everyday wear as a pullover. The liner is windproof and not fleece in the inside- but I find it makes it not so sweaty and actually keeps wind away. I also have a hard time getting my arms out of the sleeves- but other than that the small fits true to size and is a great length and width- I’m 5’2- 130lbs. It’s a great pullover to add to your collection!
review.name: Cozy and stylish

review.reviewBody: I can understand why there are mixed reviews on this piece, but this jacket has been great for what I wanted. Unlike a typical fleece, this jacket has very little give, making it feel stiffer than I was expecting, but the trade-off is that it's an extra warm, sturdy layer. The fleecy fabric is cozy, the hood is large enough to wear a hat under, and I find the boxy cut really cute for such a functional piece.
review.name: Cute and Functional

review.reviewBody: I love products from Patagonia but unfortunately, I am sending this one back. The fabric is too tough and while it looks cozy and warm from the outside, the inside material feels like more of plastic. I got size S which is one size bigger than my normal size as I wanted to wear it oversize. It still felt small, especially around armholes. I had hard time to take it off after trying it on.
review.name: Though fabric and sizing seems to be off

review.reviewBody: I purchased this due to the teddy bear color. I purchased one size up for oversize look. The material feels plastic-ish, not the most comfortable material. I think the material is hard to wash as well, it?s not as fluffy after wash even though I followed washing instructions so that was the biggest disappointment.
review.name: Love the color, not the material

review.reviewBody: This is a cute, boxy, short  jacket that goes great with jeans and boots. It?s thick and warm, but the loose cut keeps it from getting me overheated, and I like the design of the collar and hoodie?it?s comfortable and also looks cute. This jacket is really difficult to put on and take off, though, because it?s not stretchy. So I wear it as a sweater with a T or tank underneath. It?s true to size, for reference I?m 5?6? 125 lbs 34C and 27.5? waist and the Small fits perfectly.
review.name: I love it?my favorite jacket!

review.reviewBody: Very comfy, warm base layer.  Washes nicely using cold water (I used gentle machine cycle).  I cut the drying time by using the no heat, time cycle with my dryer, then laid it out flat to finish.  Looks and feels great even after washing!  Love it!
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: This is the cutest/best merino top I’ve ever found! It keeps me so warm! I usually only need this layer and my ski coat unless it’s really cold then I’ll layer a puffy as well. I love the flower/snowflake print! Such flattering base layer and I get so many compliments on the fucha color on the skin track when I’m just wearing this under my bibs! Whether you’re skiing, touring, apres-ing or lounging this is a must have set! Also, the odor resistance is awesome, I probably wash once a week and ski in it daily! True to size! I have it in the fucha and taupe color and love them both!
review.name: Only Baselayers I'll Ever Buy!

review.reviewBody:
I finally found a base layer which is warm enough for single digit degree weather. Tried icebreaker and smartwool, both not warm enough for me. 

It runs small. I usually wear size S or XS. I purchased size M and it fits me perfectly. I purchased pant in size S with same style, which is true to size.
review.name: very comfy and very warm

review.reviewBody: Fits like a glove and runs true to size. This is my new favorite brand and have ordered 2 more sets.
review.name: My favorite base layer

review.reviewBody: I am pretty picky about my wool. This feels great. But I found it to run small. Especially in the arms, and I have short arms. I?m 5?2? and 125lbs and I am sizing up to the medium. I can see me pulling the sleeves down all day in this size.
review.name: Love it but runs small

review.reviewBody: Hardly warn and already replaced once and here we are again. Usually a HUGE on fan and would recommend every product but the last few shoes have been a really big disappointment
review.name: Really disapointed

review.reviewBody: I've worked as a wilderness ranger in central Idaho for much of my life and backpacking has always been a passion of mine.  I bought them kind of randomly because I ran into them in the store and I like their running shoes.   These light boots were unbelievably comfortable.  I've tried a lot of boots over the years and these were without a doubt the most comfortable, no blisters, good traction, and water resistant boots I've worn in a long time.  I don't discount the review where they wore out quickly, but they have held up adequately for me thus far.
review.name: Wonderfully Comfortable

review.reviewBody: After weeks of putting together gear for  an upcoming hiking expedition throughout South and Central America, I went all in on these boots from ON. Maybe they're more for taking "hikes" through a suburban dog park trail or your neighborhood patch of forest because they didn't even hold up for 3 weeks of serious hiking. They started delaminating around the toes after just 2 weeks leaving me with wet feet in the back country of Chilean Patagonia. Super disappointed! Now I have to bite the bullet and buy new boots or face putting up with wet toes for the rest of my trekking in South America. The comfort was excellent and they were very light. Just terrible durability.
review.name: Really wanted to love these...

name: Cloudrock 2 Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Platypus GravityWorks 4.0L Replacement Reservoir Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GravityWorks 4.0L Replacement Reservoir Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Platypus GravityWorks 4.0L Replacement Reservoir Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Awesome system!!! The clean bags double as really great longer distance water containers (IE kayaking for a few days with no fresh water available..) can you pretty please sell them in 4L and 6L with caps??? Much more trustworthy than the "Platy bag" with the seal along its length. You might even make the bags so the caps attach with a tether, they're very easily to lose in the field.
review.name: Great products - PLEASE SELL THE CLEAN TANKS AND CAPS!!!

review.reviewBody: I have used Gravity Works for years and they have never failed me. The extra weight is worth it.
review.name: Love my GW

review.reviewBody: Hands down the best water filter I’ve ever used in 30 years of drinking from backcountry streams and lakes. It’s miraculously easy to set up, walk away and the next time you glance at it you have four liters of clean, clear, and tasteless water. My only gripe is why can’t the Clean reservoir have the same wide zip-loc opening as the Dirty reservoir to allow easier drying and cleaning? The little soda cap opening on the Clean reservoir doesn’t allow enough air exchange to permit proper drying in less than 2 days, promoting mildew growth and more frequent cleaning, which is also a pain because of the small opening. So close to five stars, but not quite.
review.name: Difficult to dry

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the 4l replacement reservoirs for my Platypus filter which had the 2l reservoirs. I used them on a backcountry hunt/camp. Unfortunately no pictures. They were a game changer. I love the ease of using the Platy system and the 4l size was great. Allowed us to fill our water bottles, make food, and some left over for hydration before having to make our way to the stream to refill. Odd that the clean res. didn't come with a cap though...?
review.name: I recently purchased the 4l

review.reviewBody:
Great system but there is evidently some product quality issues that make it through as noted with some of these reviews. For me, the Clean bag has delaminated along one side of the hard threaded plastic. This results in water spraying everywhere when filling directly from the Clean bag, or newly filtered water leaking out of the Clean bag if it is being filled from the filter line at certain angles.

Also as noted by others, I hear nothing back from the Cascade Designs warranty team after filling out about one form per year. I wouldn't complain about purchasing it a new bag if it were more reasonably priced.
review.name: Seam Failure

review.reviewBody: I love the system, but the receiving reservoir is just a waste of money and resources. I filter directly into clean Platypus water bags (1 and 2 liter). You should sell just the “dirty” reservoir with a Platypus connector below the filter on the outlet hose.
review.name: Sell the “dirty” reservoir only as an option

review.reviewBody: I'll start out by saying that I love my 4L Gravity Works filter system. It's an effortless and easy way to provide lots of water while camping with groups. The frustration that many people have with the thick stubborn zippers seems to be necessary to be able to resist the weight of 4L of water, and I have accepted that ease will not correlate well to the necessary resistance. The dirty bag I have no problems with, other than it is tricky to clean out the hose-attachment port. The clean bag, however, is impossible to clean out due to it being completely sealed besides the single tiny little opening through which you can add or release water. This means cleaning is limited to swishing around soapy water, and no way to ventilate or dry the entire bag to prevent mold from growing. I would prefer a second bag with a large mouth opening so I could at least clean out this bag properly, which is why I would not recommend this product if you need a new clean bag (if you need a new dirty bag, I supposed it could be worth the purchase). Instead just buy the 4L water tank as this will serve the exact same purpose but be easier to clean.
review.name: Expensive replacement for the simple parts of the system

review.reviewBody: I wanted to be able to have more water ready to filter at one time. If only the mouth was easier to open and close, and bigger to make it easier to fill. Maybe I should have tried a 4L.
review.name: Fine product

review.reviewBody: I backpack for at least one week per summer. After two trips, the dirty reservoir valve jammed and I couldn't clip the filter to it. I never let this part of the bag touch the ground it simply clogged with the silty water I was having to filter. I ended up having to filter water through my sock and ad iodine tablets for the last two days of hiking. I like the convenience of this system, but bring a back up of iodine tablets in case!
review.name: Lasted for 2 trips, failed on the third

review.reviewBody: Why in the world would you sell a reservoir to hold water without a cap? Filter the water into the clean reservoir and then disconnect so that it can spill out everywhere? I thought for sure my purchase had not been packaged correctly. I understand that other caps are compatible, but why not just sell it with one?
review.name: Lack of a cap is dumb

name: GravityWorks 4.0L Replacement Reservoir Kit

description: Buy the Kakadu BlockOut Cot Tent: 1-Person online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: BlockOut Cot Tent: 1-Person
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kakadu BlockOut Cot Tent: 1-Person online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love this tent. I've used it 3 times and love the easy set-up, protection and comfort.
review.name: Kakadu Block out Cot Tent

review.reviewBody: Got this cot tent for a supported 6 day bike ride. Used a 2" mattress on the cot and slept great. Used the fly one night because Iwe were set up in a city park that had big lights on all night. Pitch black inside. Every other night with just the bug net. So nice to swing my legs out of the tent instead of getting up off the ground. Highly recommend
review.name: Kakadu cot tent

review.reviewBody: Nice product. One person size makes tending to one’s needs under cover hard but I slept so good, I thought I was at home when I woke up. It stays super dark so I got to sleep in. So dark I could not see ig at night when coming back from the bathroom. Can’t put too much weight on the head of the cot getting because it isn’t supported by framing. Has to breath so using lines to hold the fly out is a must.
review.name: Cot tent is awesome.

review.reviewBody: Impulse buying can be conflicting sometimes. But, the items I got was real high quality at 40% off. Once delivered they were real keepers! No remorse!
review.name: Excellent sale!

name: BlockOut Cot Tent: 1-Person

review.reviewBody: Great warm vest, perfect for layering. Would recommend.
review.name: Great Value

review.reviewBody: I like the cozy fleece lined pockets. I don't appreciate the synthetic shoulders and collar. It packs down small and keeps me warm at camp. I really wanted an ultralight down jacket that doesn't have those stupidly small baffles. This isn't ultralight, but it's close enough.
review.name: Warm and Light

review.reviewBody: Amazing vest, at an amazing price. Lightweight and slim fitting.
review.name: Amazing vest, at an amazing price

review.reviewBody: Stylish, warm, and light. Great go to vest for that fall and spring cool weather.
review.name: Great vest

review.reviewBody: Works great with a hoodie while walking the dog or no shirt...suns out gunz out!!
review.name: Fantastic product, great fit!

review.reviewBody: Solid insulating layer under a waterproof jacket. Great top layer for colder weather when you don't need sleeves. I run warm and don't need a lot of layers. This is a great mid layer with something windproof and waterproof over it. Personally, I would like a chest pocket for a more utilitarian outer layer, but I am happy with it regardless.
review.name: I like it.

review.reviewBody: Quality seems great for the price, light weight and solid zipper. Looks great on me and very warm. I mostly wear it on short walks in 20-30 degree weather and it does the trick without being restrictive. Would buy again!
review.name: Great best!

review.reviewBody: This product is very warm and has kept me warm down to freezing, and toasty above that. However, within a week the collar became discolored / darker. Never had this issue with other jackets but it's worth keeping in mind. It's not enough of an issue for me to want to return it b/c it's performance is so good.
review.name: Very warm for a vest but some discoloration around collar

review.reviewBody: 6'2 190 lbs and the medium is a perfect athletic fit over a few layers of merino. Packs down small and is so light you dont notice it. Great for winter layering and spring/fall shoulder seasons.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: This was a gift and though I paid for expedited delivery it arrived way to late. When I opened the package I was disappointed in the level of down loft, seemed skimpy to me for this brand. I would not buy again and will be returning this men's down vest..
review.name: very disappointed

name: Coldfront Down Vest - Men's

review.reviewBody: I've worn various running tights across different brands, and this is my current top pick. I'd be excited to see the same versatile features on a next to skin running short.
review.name: Excellent winter running tight

review.reviewBody:
I have three of these pants. 
Chicago winter 38 F° wind over 25 miles per hour. No bottom baselayer, no problem at all. It's so warm and comfortable and seems to be last long time.
review.name: Best in the market

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these tights. They keep me warm for winter hikes that I love to do.
review.name: I would but these again and highly recommend them

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect winter tights! I had an earlier version that didn't have the side cell phone pocket or rear zippered pocket. I had to use an iron on pocket that later ended up ruining the tights. Glad that they added these as well as the waist pouches for fuel or extras, like gloves. If you also owned previous versions, be aware that the sizing is different. The medium fits like the small used to. Overall these are amazing and worth the $.
review.name: The prefect winter tights!

review.reviewBody: I have an older pair of TNF pants and the zippered ankles caused hot spots. This pair does not have them. However, the fabric is much looser than I would have expected-they are not compression tight. When I pull the fabric up, they sit way high above my waist and I have to fold them down.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable and warm
review.name: Try it on.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great for sub-freezing runs. Keeps you warm but no issues easily keeping pace on your run. Easy to wash.
review.name: Keeps you warm!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like them

review.name: Love the pockets

review.reviewBody: Warm, comfortable, fits nicely with layers (otherwise it may look lose to some), and get some name or custom patches with velcro/hook for each arm side as this has the velcro/loop on it for sticking to it.
review.name: This is my summit suit

review.reviewBody: Good design with a caveat. Helmet friendly. Pockets include handwarming ones at the waist. Ventilation is easily achieved by unzipping the under-sleeve zippers. The suspenders are there when needed, but the suit can be worn without having them on one's shoulders which is more comfortable than other suits that require stepping into the suspenders to put on the suit. Adjustment options for the waist and hood are easy to tweak. If the zipper access in the center front went under the torso it would be a lot better. Taking guidance from men's anatomy, the suit zipper opens along the center tothe front of the inseam rather than where a woman needs it: midway base between the front and back of the torso. There is no easy way to relieve oneself without a potential liquid spill. There is a rainbow zipper in the back, but that is less convenient and more than should be necessary when the need is simple.
review.name: Super Warm

name: Absolute Zero Suit - Women's

review.reviewBody: hi OR awesome hat but the logo is ambiguously trail-y and I was thinking, a great logo for this collection might be an "OR" where the "O" is represented by the silhouette of a 12-gear cassette. THAT says mountain bike! Thanks
review.name: could we make the logo more mountain-bikey?

review.reviewBody: The hat is a solid hat from Outdoor Research. It reminds me of one of my favorite hats from 4-5 years ago from OR. The hat is a mid crowd hat compared to other older models breathable trucker hats. The material breaths well and the adjustment system is simple and easy to adjust on windy days. You can throw it in your bag in the morning and wear for happy hour beers after a ride. Easy to clean or wash off on a a rainy day. Solid boat or river hat too.
review.name: Great hat for active people!!

review.reviewBody: This hat is a great performance hat for everything. It is a little heavier than a normal swift hat, but I tend to like a heavier hat as this one is more durable. The connection point in the back is stretchy which is very comfortable. I have been running with this hat and it has become my go-to running hat. I am very picky with my hats and this OR hat ticks all the boxes of what I would consider to be a great hat.
review.name: Awesome Hat!
