review.name: Really nice jacket. Love the

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lighter jacket than I expected. So far seems warm but haven’t been able to test it in the snow yet.
review.name: Lighter jacket than I expected.

review.reviewBody: This is an awesome jacket. It runs true to size color options are great Goretex is second and none. good ventilation.
review.name: Nice looking jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my wife's favorite jacket, not only does she wear it on those blizzardy commutes but also is perfect on fair weather dog walks! Don't get it twisted though, this jacket is perfect for any condition on the slopes!
review.name: Great Everyday Outerwear

review.reviewBody:
I just bought this coat and skied in 10 degrees, (0 with windchill) with a moderate snow all day. 

I wore a Merino Wool base layer by Smartwool and a Patagonia Nano Puff underneath. I was worried this coat wouldn’t be warm enough but I stayed very warm and dry the entire day. The GORE-TEX does a great job keeping moisture out.   

What I didn’t like: the logo on the arm looks really cheap. This is confusing and frustrating for a $360 coat and 686 needs to do better. The main zipper also sticks quite a bit and I would have expected better quality.  

Overall, I think this is a good buy and I like that it’s longer to cover some of my butt. I also like the neck coverage which is needed in colder, snowy, windy weather. The inside pockets are nice. As someone who’s taller and lanky, at  5’9”, the wrist gaiters were too short to use but that’s a normal issue for me.
review.name: Great Coat, minor flaws

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this jacket for snowboarding and as always with 686 the quality and functionality of all of the pockets/storage areas is great. I love my GLCR Goretex Willow jacket that I’ve had for a few years and decided to buy another (this jacket) in black after trying other brands and just not liking the fit and functionality as much as I like 686. This version of the willow jacket isn’t the exact same as my older GLCR willow jacket (it doesn’t have the same thin, flexible feel and fit) so it feels just slightly more marshmallow-y than the older version, but that is probably just because it’s new and hasn’t been broken in yet. This jacket has been my go-to for both freezing and warm resort days because it keeps out water and snow, is breathable on warm days, and is great for layering (I’m 5’3 120lbs and bought a medium for a slightly looser and longer fit). Stick with your size for a fitted look, or go up one for a looser/snowboarding fit and it still shouldn’t be too big.
review.name: Favorite Snow Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this jacket. Bought it for my first snowboarding season and it's super comfortable, stays nice and dry especially for someone for falls a lot, and the pocket number is insane. I got a size medium for a baggy fit and it's perfect.
review.name: Great for beginner snowboarder

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Kept me super warm and dry, and has a good amount of room for layers without being too bulky or tight.
review.name: All you need

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit, very warm. High quality. Delivered quickly.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Gore-tex and insulation makes this jacket perform great and keeps me warm! Love how it looks and fits great!
review.name: Favorite snowboarding jacket

hasVariant.name: Shift Pro 120 Alpine Touring Boot - 2024
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon Shift Pro 120 Alpine Touring Boot - 2024 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Pretty disappointed with this boot. I had these boots custom fit and heat molded. I've found the stiffness of the boot when leaning into the boot is not nearly a 120 flex after having the shell heated. When pushing into the shin piece while skiing you can feel the top of the boot (above your feet) collapse in. I have very wide feet and cannot fit into any boot out of the box. I regret purchasing these boots.
review.name: Not Stiff After Heating Up Shell
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody:
(Take this review with a grain of salt, this is on my foot of this model the feel will be completely different for most people)

I’ve been using this boot for about 2 months and I’ve been loving it. It’s great for touring and on piest. However I have a vary small ankle and low calf so I hade a lot of vertical motion in the boot and I’m currently getting some vary vary mild shin bang from needing to looses the buckles. I fixed the vertical movement with a custom foot bed and a 4mm heel lift in the liner. Now I only feel it when doing a nose butter. That being said this boot impressed me in every other way from the flex to the range of motion the hike mode. This is a vary impressive boot.
review.name: Perfect hybrid boot

review.reviewBody: This is the 4th pair of Salomon ski boots I have owned.  Been skiing on various XMaxs for  years 10 years.....skiing 100+ days a season.  With each generation, Salomon boots get better and better.  The Shift Pro continues the improvement.  Great fit and sturdy as can be....well done Salomon!
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: I bought a few weeks ago. Love the weight for riding, love the stiffness and downhill performance, and so easy to go from walk to ride. A little to heavy for extended tours.
review.name: Love these boots!

review.reviewBody: I usually don’t write reviews about products but this one deserves it. I equipped myself this year with a touring setup. I have armada arv 106 skis with shift bindings. I was looking for gear that I could use both in backcountry as well as in resort and I am very impressed with these boots. They are fairly light compare to other four buckle touring boots, they sit very close to your feet and they are super comfortable. The walking mode provides a good range of motion. Great boot overall!!
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody: Bought this boot hopefully to be the quiver killer - 4 buckle, resort worthy, pin compatible and lightweight. Super impressed with the ski-ability of the boot and the boot is impressively lightwight for a 4 buckle boot. Highly recommended!
review.name: Shift Pro Boot Review

name: Shift Pro 120 Alpine Touring Boot - 2024

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The fabric is breathable and the pants are the perfect length for me (5ft.3in/159 cm) without any alterations. Have gone hiking, ATVing, and camping with this. The only con is that the butt area pills - it did so even just after the second wear.
review.name: Almost perfect.

review.reviewBody: These hiking pants fit great, are stretchy, and dry quickly. Being short, they were full-length on me, and I appreciated the ties at the bottom. I hiked most of the Wonderland Trail in them, and they were perfect. Not too hot or cool and plenty of stretch. They got completely soaked in the rain, but dried quickly while wearing them. I recommend them!
review.name: Stretchy and great for hiking

review.reviewBody: I use all day or comfortable for work walking for everything
review.name: Of course, I buy again and again in another colors

review.reviewBody: These are so comfortable, lightweight, and quick drying. I am super glad I chose these over the zip offs. They don't hold odor even after several hot weather wears without washing.
review.name: Great Hiking Pants

review.reviewBody: They don't look nearly as nerdy on as they do in these photos. Super stretchy and haven't pulled or snagged yet. I sized up because I have a large waist, otherwise they fit true-to-size
review.name: My new fave climbing pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Not only are the pants I received made very differently from these, they are huge at the waist & too tight on the calves. Makes for a really awkward look & feel. I've had awful luck with sizing @ TNF lately, nothing was sized to their chart, everything was way too large. I received pants that are pull on, no zippers or button, the fit is way off, they measured 30" @ the waist for a size 0 - not 25/26 as the chart states. Not slim to the waist or hips. The belt is placed differently, not hidden thru the back. The material is way thinner & too flexible, almost see thru, pulls in fabric & seams. 100% not the pants shown, or described. So disappointed, I'd never expect this from TNF, especially for the cost of their products. I miss the days of when higher costs equated to higher quality.
review.name: Pants I received are NOT what's pictured...

review.reviewBody: I like the style and fabric of the pants. Unfortunately, they run large so I have to cinch the top quite a bit. Next size down is sold out, so I'm out of luck. The silhouette doesnt match the pictures, likely because they are too large. Definitely buy a size down from your regular. DWR coating is good, water beads right off them.
review.name: Runs large

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Length is not good. Ideal types of a pair of pants for daily use.
review.name: I won't not buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought size 6 that is my size always but it runs bigger.
review.name: Runs bigger

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These pants exceeded my expectations with their superb comfort and stylish design. The quality material and perfect fit make them a standout addition to my wardrobe.
review.name: Great pants

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Performance Elite Dropper Seatpost-Internal Routing
review.reviewBody: At first I was a little bit reluctant about a dropper post, but many of my ridding buddies have them on their bikes and seems a nice tool when riding. Decided to give it a go it has been a great tool when ridding downhill. The quality of the dropper is awesome, feels solid, fast response and seems durable. I have been using it a lot and don't know why it took me so long to get one. At first I was trying to adjust the timing to when I should lowered but I got a nice rhythm.
review.name: Nice Addition to the bike

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Performance Elite Dropper Seatpost-Internal Routing
review.reviewBody:
got his to replace the stock giant dropper on my wifes new liv. the giant dropper would not insert all the way into the tube, it was up 2", so my wife could not touch the ground that well when dropped.

well this nice fox solved that problem due to it short insert length so now she is able to comfortably touch the ground. it has a nice smooth operation. mated with a tranzx dropper lever makes the package complete.

2 things to beware of, it has slight play in the post when raised and is only for 7mm seat rails.
review.name: nice dropper, for 7mm seat rails

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Performance Elite Dropper Seatpost-Internal Routing
review.reviewBody: Works as designed.  Nice that it does not have a fast return.  I've used in hot and cold weather and it works the same.  Not enough time on it to determine durability.  Given the cost, hope to have it work properly for the next several years.
review.name: Works Great

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Performance Elite Dropper Seatpost-Internal Routing
review.reviewBody: I have this dropper on my bike and bought this for my daughter to replace her seat post. Works great, easy install...she loves it.
review.name: Great dropper

name: Transfer Performance Elite Dropper Seatpost-Internal Routing

review.reviewBody: My 11 year old loves these because they’re warm, keep his feet dry and he says they’re really comfortable. I didn’t love the price point but it’s really hard to find something that checks all the boxes. I know he’ll put them through the wringer and they’ll last and I’ll still be able to resell them for a small portion so I was ok with the price. He wears women’s sizes because of not fitting into men’s yet but loved that these were unisex. He wears a 7 1/2 in his Nike running shoes, an 8 in his Brooks gortex Trail runners but needed these in an 8 1/2 I imagine because of the thermal insole.
review.name: My 11 year old loves them!

name: All Terrain Thermal Boot

review.reviewBody:
Size and easy setup good eco system with brand JOOLCA. 

Recommend ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: It's so nice to be able to enjoy a tub bath when you are boondocking. To be able to relax is the best!
review.name: A must have

review.reviewBody: This thing gets hot! Plenty of room for two. Plus being able to set it up anywhere=kick @$$!
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: It’s so sturdy and comfortable. Easy to set up and pack away.
review.name: It’s amazing. Fits me and the missus great.

review.reviewBody: We love it, The “liner” is thick and seems to be very resistant to puncture and abuse. It stays warm for a long time, the cover has a double lock on clips which keeps the younger kids out. You can easily hook up an inline filter too with some simple hose adapters and reuse the water. We use some mild water treatment and circulate the water on a daily bases. No issues so far! No regrets buying it
review.name: We love it and plenty of room for 2 people

review.reviewBody:
Pros: very light! Very spacious! Glad it came with a cover. So far, using it once, took a few hours to heat up which was normal and expected.

Cons: no cons on the hot tub itself. However though… using it with hot tap/ power bank and plug in power adapter with the splitter…
1. The power bank couldn’t keep up with the hot tap and pump, it would drain n shut off the hot tap and the pump would shut off too. So I had to plug the pump into a jump pack and put the battery pack back in the hot tap and run it off the D batteries.
2. I first set the temp up to the high setting, but the hot tap would shut off because it was reading 120 degrees. However the water in the hot tub was cold at the bottom and Luke warm on the top. After stirring it around was better, yet the unit kept shutting off for over temp. I had to put it at its lowest setting and kept it at 108 degrees. But after awhile, it would still shut off at its lowest setting. This is the 3rd time I used the hot tap. It worked great the first two times, however, it was running off of cold water, not circulating warm water.
review.name: Hot tub/ hot tap

name: Hottub

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This works absolutely great when you are sitting out in the woods hunting or but taking for a camping trip as an extra seat. It’s super easy to carry around and light weight. The insulation names it’s very comfortable. Might just have to buy all the hunters in my family a set.
review.name: Great versatility/comfortable seating

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This worked out great on a camping trip hubby and I took.  Besides using it as a seat we also used it to add extra for us when sleeping.  It is smaller but mighty when it comes to insulation.  The material is also strong as it was put to the test on the trip.
review.name: Great and useful product

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently tried out the SOL Escape Insulated Trail Seat on a few of my outdoor adventures, and it has quickly become a favorite piece of gear.

The SOL Escape Insulated Trail Seat is built to last. It’s tough enough to withstand rough terrain and frequent use without showing signs of wear and tear. The materials are also water-resistant, which is a huge plus for damp environments.

Weighing just a few ounces, this trail seat is extremely lightweight and easy to carry. It comes with a stuff sack, making it compact and convenient to pack in your backpack. 

This seat is not just for hiking and camping. I’ve used it at outdoor sports events, picnics, and even as a kneeling pad while gardening. Its versatility makes it a great addition to any outdoor activity.
review.name: Versatile Trail Seat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product for free from Influenster to give me honest review. I like that this product is easy to store and pack with me. I like that it’s insulated and have used this during outdoor sports events when the bleachers were wet and it seemed to work well. I would recommend this for anyone who has a child in sports or likes to watch sports outside.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect addition to my backpacking kit! I absolutely love that it comes with a compression travel bag and is made out of very sturdy material. I tried it out camping and was very impressed how well it worked. Just make sure you put the correct side down!
review.name: I love to take a seat!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This seat is great! Able to take to sporting events, hiking, or anywhere you need a lightweight and portable seat. The seat also keeps a comfortable temperature via the insulation built into the seat. Also able to withstand wet West Coast temperatures!
review.name: Lightweight, durable insulated hiking seat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is great for camping or sitting outside by the lake at night.  It is soft enough to sit on the ground or on a hard cold chair.  It does keep your body temperature even and not cold.  Can’t wait to use while camping at night in the fall?
review.name: Great for outdoors

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a perfect portable trail seat that fits in your pocket. Well insulated material. I like the colors and design. Very affordable. I would recommend it!
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very high quality insulated seat. It’s great and does it’s job. It also somehow fits in a small bag and is travel friendly. It’s easy to carry around hiking. I would highly recommend it to people who hike a lot in cold places. It will keep your butt very warm.😄
review.name: Nice product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Was very comfortable durable and easy to pack it was super helpful to have with us for our hike and easy to store in our belongings would definitely recommend
review.name: Easy to store

review.itemreviewed: Jackal GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ordered these shoes for a last minute hiking trip/trail running.   I am a size 10 women?s and had to exchange them for a size 43 as the 42 was too small.  The 43 fit great - with the exception that the shoe is too wide for my average female foot.  The shoe is a great waterproof shoe and I love the look of them - great colors!  But overall the shoe is too wide for any technical hiking or rocky trail running.  They will now just serve as a winter/wet dog walking shoe unless I can re-fit them with an insert to take up some of the extra space, otherwise they are just too unstable.  I wish they would make a women specific shoe.
review.name: Great shoe - but way too wide for female

review.itemreviewed: Jackal GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have been looking at trail running shoes to replace my two year old Doggo Parcours which were a bit tight in the forefoot.  I use them to run my dogs in agility and wanted waterproof. I need a wide forefoot but only for my right foot.   I ordered two sizes and the 40 fit perfectly (I wear a 7.5 in regular shoes) - the upper mesh allowed me to tighten up the left foot. Used them in class today and for once my feet did not hurt. Back County's customer service is phenomenal.
review.name: Perfect shoes for dog agility

name: Jackal GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: A superb helmet lightweight comfortable extremely well made for all riding conditions
review.name: Smith forefront mips

review.reviewBody: I had a big crash on the White Rim trail that broke my collarbone and dented my helmet, left me with a knot above my left eye as well. My helmet was on tight and kept me from what could have been a terrible head injury. I will replace with same helmet when I can ride again. The ability to lock this helmet tight on my head was key. The ER doc was impressed!
review.name: Crash tested and Amazing

review.reviewBody: The helmet is lightweight, well-ventilated, and has an easily adjustable fit that stays secure on the head.
review.name: Nicely adjustable fit

review.reviewBody:
Crash tested into asphalt, could still remember my birthday as well as America’s and my wife’s (which is not always a given.


 The fit system is phenomenal and the flip up visor is wildly under rated. Comfy, breathable and safe, buying the exact same one to replace it.
review.name: Comfy and crash certified, did not concus

review.reviewBody: Loved this helmet and had the chin strap break from the helmet behind the ear after less than a year of wearing it. They said it did not qualify for the warranty and have not provided a reason. I am disappointed their written policy was not upheld. Great helmet look and fit otherwise. Really not sure what happened to the attachment point though, has not happened on any other helmet I’ve had.
review.name: Warranty issue

review.reviewBody: I just had my first (and last) interaction with Smith customer service. Poor is an understatement. I have a Smith Forefront 2 I purchased at the end of the season 2022. The inner liner that is supposed to move in a crash is now cracked and will not stay in place. This makes the helmet move around freely. I have never been in a crash or dropped the helmet. Smiths response is “Sorry it's not under warranty here is a 20% off of a new helmet”... Really?!?! I have to trash my helmet because a flimsy piece of plastic cannot be replaced? Crazy. I've had interactions with many other companies in the outdoor industry and this is by far the worst. I will never purchase another Smiths product. Too bad because until the liner cracked it was a great product.
review.name: Horrible Customer Service

review.reviewBody: Looks good and feels pretty good. My hair gets stuck in one spot in the front sometimes and I get a bit of a headache if I have it tightened down snuggly. Only giving four stars because I ended up with a whole different color combo from what I ordered, but I like it now that it’s here.
review.name: Solid helmet

review.reviewBody: The helmets appear to be good quality. Unfortunately, Smith’s sizing charts say a Youth medium snow helmet and an adult medium bike helmet have identical circumferences. We got the bike helmet and they weren’t even remotely close. Sizing should be consistent throughout a company, and head circumference sizing should be a pretty easy thing to get consistent.
review.name: Sizing throughout the Smith line is inconsistent

review.reviewBody: Easy to fit and comfortable. In addition not like other helmets I had in the past, it gives protection again the sun while maintaining ventilation.
review.name: Easy to fit and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Great fit for me. Comfortable. Good coverage. I like the visor and how mobile it is and how it holds its position.
review.name: Love it!

name: Forefront 2 Mips Helmet
Forefront 2 Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: As a curvier individual, it can be hard to find comfortable snow clothes that look good. These look and fit great. They are not too bulky and the adjustable shoulders make it a customizable fit.
review.name: Great color and very comfortable

review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly where I can wear light to medium layers underneath. Love the inner thighs vents. Access area is one of better design than other snow bibs. Has all the functions of normal bib which is hard to find in my size. (Im 5'11'" and Bought XXL)
review.name: Worth it.

review.reviewBody: Love these for colder days but I wouldn't say they are incredibly warm which is fine since I can always wear thicker long undies. A bit of a baggy leg look, but somewhat typical of insulated OR pants. My only issue is the chest zippered pocket isn't quite big enough my iPhone to sit upright so my wire headphone cable doesn't get crimped. (I know, first world problems.) The chest pocket in my other OR bibs (the Carbide) is plenty big enough.
review.name: Love em

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my wife. She used them multiple times skiing and outside with the kids this winter. Durable and great looking
review.name: Just buy them

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to like these bibs (the calcite color is amazing!), but they were just too baggy on me. I ordered my usual size, a medium (I am 5'10" and 155lb for reference). I'd say I am somewhere between a thin and athletic build, and these were just loose in all the wrong places. They were super loose on the sides of the chest, and very baggy in the butt, save for where they rode up my butt crack, which could be because of my height. I'd imagine if you have a larger chest these could be a good fit, but I wound up returning. On that note, thank you OR for making returns a breeze!
review.name: Emphasis on relaxed fit

review.reviewBody: Kept me dry! Warm! Long for me at 5’0. Would look nicer on someone with curves.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Love it! Not too baggy not too lose
review.name: Highly recommend easy zip on and off

review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace my old ski pants and I’m so glad o did. I love the pattern and they’re super comfortable. I stayed warm in a super windy day and didn’t overheat the next weekend when it was warmer. My only complaint is that I sized up, which was unnecessary. They’re definitely too big, but I’d prefer that to too small.
review.name: Obsessed with these bibs!

review.reviewBody: Bought these for a trip to Iqaluit and they were prefect for breaking the wind and keeping me warm. I was just walking around town at -35 with wind and was super warm. Looking forward to trying them out for more outdoor activities (hiking/sking) but even some upcoming outdoor events, good as a wind layer and paired with base layers. I'm, 5'2 170 lbs and the large fit well with layers. They are still pretty long even for the short version.
review.name: Nice wind layer for Northern living...

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and fairly flattering. Kept me dry even on wet chair lifts. They are not very thick so I was worried about warmth, but I was just the right temperature.
review.name: Comfortable and performs well.

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
When you are outside and the summer sun is beating down upon you, those typical cotton shirts just seem get soaked and stay wet forever. While this shirt is not going to stop the sweat from happening, once you step into the shade for a nice cool drink, this shirt will quickly dry off and keep you not only feeling cool, but looking cool as well.  Whether it's a quick mow or a night out on the town with the special lady, this shirt will keep you looking and feeling your best. I liked it so much, I bought every color they had. 

It's a great travel shirt for those heading off to the beach or those Florida theme parks. It packs down nice and small so you can look your best while waiting in line for that turkey leg you think you just had to have.
review.name: Great Summer Shirt

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shirts are the best.  I work from home and I wear one every day. I am 6’ tall and 225 pounds and I get a xxl.
review.name: Yes

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great shirt for getting after it, whether in the gym or on the mountain.  Excellent wicking capability, works great as a base layer when you need to layer up.  A little stretchy, but not as stretchy as some of their past models.
review.name: Love This Shirt!

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have  bought total 4 shirts with different sizes and colours for my family.
The colours are very good and most important of all, the material is good for hot and humid summer.
Love  it.
review.name: very good T shirt for the hot summer

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Stop thinking n buy this t-shirt. Period?? Really folks u'll be very happy with your decision.
review.name: Gr8 tee!!

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought 3, loved the shirt so much that I now have 14. I now wear them every day and have one on as I type.
Cool to wear, stretchy and doesn?t seem to permanently stretch out of shape, great stain resistance, dries quickly, soft.
My favorite shirt. Fits perfectly in width and length.
review.name: Comfort, wicking, cool - unparalleled

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love this shirt.  It's not only one of the best fitting, most comfortable shirts I own, but it also does it's job extremely well.  Definitely getting more colors (Love the orange so far).
review.name: New favorite shirt

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great quality , good fit and super comfortable.  Nice colors too!
review.name: Great Comfortable Shirt

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I LOVE the color of this shirt. The fabric is so soft and is great at wicking sweat. Will def consider maybe getting a different color
review.name: Great shirt!

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have owned a bunch of T-shirts over the years but I can honestly say that this one is a solid 5 Star! It fits great, hangs great and is about as smooth to the touch as cashmere. The UPF rating and the odor control just add to garment's greatness.  And if you are a Tennessee fan, the Mango color is pretty great too. I bought 5 of those and 5 of the Big Sky Blue which is sort of a heather deal with some white in the fabric.  I am a happy camper,
review.name: AWESOME T!

review.reviewBody:
The drive side would fit halfway, then it would get too tight so I stopped. The non drive side would not screw in at all. I hand tight both sides, and it just would not screw in. Upon close inspection of the threads, you can clearly see the threads isn't lined up correctly. 

I can't believe this passed quality control. Something so important and can potentially ruin a bike frame should be closely inspected. Lesson learned, never buying Chris King products again.
review.name: Almost Ruined My Bike Frame.
comment: Hi, Khan sorry for the frustration with installing this bottom bracket. Give us a call, or chat in and we can help find an alternative for you or possibly troubleshoot your installation issue. Our experts are here to help, call us and we will take care of you.1-888-276-7130

name: ThreadFit T47A-24 Bottom Bracket

review.reviewBody: I bought them for my wife she loves how they feel Super comfortable
review.name: I would buy again

review.reviewBody: I was at wits end with PF..bought these on a whim..wonderful! comfort and no pain at last. Many thanks for your saving-my-sanity product!
review.name: I had my doubts.....

review.reviewBody: Not a true slip on material is so soft, I couldn't get it on without hands. I use a customized insert. This shoe's insert was so think that when I took it out and put mine in, the shoe was too loose. This would have been my 4th pair of Hokas. Love the others. Had knee replacement recently and wanted to be able to just slip in to them. Looks like I'm going to have to stick with Skechers Slip Ins.
review.name: Can't be put on hands free

review.reviewBody: Love the shoes. Love them but they are very narrow and killed my little toe. Can't wear them. Pleaseeeeee make them in a wide. Pleaseeeeeeeeeeeee
review.name: Too narrow

review.reviewBody: I love Hoka shoes. As they always are, these are super comfortable and fit well. My only issue is being able to "slip in" to them. I always seem to get the fabric part of the heel curled just a bit that I have to put my finger between my foot had the heel fabric to straighten it back out. Otherwise, will buy again.
review.name: Super comfortable. Having trouble with the "slip in" part

review.reviewBody: Absolutely the most comfortable shoe I have ever had on my feet. My neuropathy makes my feet hurt a lot and most shoes just further irritate.....not these - worth every penny. I just ordered another pair.
review.name: The best!

review.reviewBody: I have very severe foot joint arthritis. And have been in uncontrollable pain. I bought the recovery tc and have been wearing them for less than 24 hrs and all my pain is gone. I have never had a shoe like this and I am always buying shoes for special for feet problems . I feel like I am walking on clouds and I do a lot of standing and walking . I cannot say enough great things. Thank you so much.
review.name: I would buy again

review.reviewBody: Very soft. Maybe a little too much rocker, especially in the fore foot. I had to buy a size 12 when my typical size is 11, even in other Hoka shoes. The outsole in general is bigger and clunkier than I'd like. I dislike how far the outsole protrudes from my actual heel. The heel outsole makes my foot sit higher on the gas pedal in the car and it almost causes me to trip as it clips stairs I'm stepping down from. The large heel outsole seems part of the Hoka identity but I'm starting to get tired of tripping.
review.name: A good recovery shoe.

review.reviewBody: Cloud-like comfort, attention grabbing looks, dare to wear them. Worth the price and looks for the comfort!
review.name: Most comfortable ugly shoes I've ever worn!

review.reviewBody: loved the comfort and fit of this shoe, only issue was it dug in on the outside of my foot, just a little annoying at first, but I soon realized it was untenable, it hurt. I contacted customer service, we "chatted" and I was able to return the shoes, initially for an exchange, but the shoe I ordered was out of stock so my exchange was modified to a return and I reordered the same shoe, same size, different color hoping it will not dig in on the side of my foot like the last pair. If it does I'll have to return it too and it's back to the ol' drawing board, cause otherwise these shoes are exactly what I was looking for.
review.name: had to return, hoping a different pair will work

name: Restore TC Shoe

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I travel 4x a year internationally and have found this is the best travel accessory I could own. Using it as a backpack or bag is awesome. Highly recommend!
review.name: Best Travel Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Everything about this travel bag is perfect - design and functionality is as good as it gets.
review.name: Great Bag!!

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag for a European train trip. I needed one bag for all of my luggage, and wanted to keep my camera gear organized from the rest of my stuff. This bag is huge. The cavernous center offers all kinds of opportunities for organization. Oh, and the quality is built to last a lifetime.
review.name: Rugged and Convenient

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Looking for the ultimate backpack/travel bag? Look no further! The 40L option is an absolute game-changer, offering ample room for all your needs. From work to the gym to jet-setting adventures, this bag has you covered.

For gym sessions, it effortlessly accommodates workout clothes, shoes, training gear, and even a spacious lunchbox, thanks to its smart design. Plus, with a dedicated waterproof top pouch, you can stash essentials like a 32oz water bottle. 

When it's time to hit the road, the ranger roll method with packing cubes maximizes space, allowing you to pack for up to 10 days! And with its durable, waterproof construction, this bag can handle whatever your journey throws at it, whether it's a spilled drink or unexpected rain shower.

Incredibly versatile and easy to clean, this bag is a true investment in convenience and functionality. Don't hesitate—upgrade your travel game today!
review.name: GREAT MULTIPURPOSE BAG

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Je l'utilise depuis plusieurs années pour des trajets professionnels. L'organisation du sac est très efficace !!
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this backpack/duffel bag. When fully filled it does become too heavy for carry on just fyi. But designed really well for travel. Took to Indonesia for a month as my main bag and it worked perfectly! Durable and discreet
review.name: Optimal bag

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great bag--high quality--as advertised.
Highly recommend it.
review.name: Great bag--high quality--as advertised. Highly

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] the 30 would have been too small and the 40 is a little large but the design is smart and very functional.
review.name: I'm a little picky

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The 40L size is very spacious. The outer pockets are well thought out and are quite functional. Zippers and water resistant materials are excellent. A few more main compartment side storage pockets are could have helped for even greater functionality. Overall, this is a very well thought out travel bag.
review.name: A good product for travel

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought it for use as a multipurpose bag and it has not disappointed. 

The bag lives most of its life as my gym bag to transport my martial arts gear to and from class. The volume is perfected the shoe compartment is great for my slide sandals, and the various storage pockets are great for storing all miscellanies pieces of gear I need (notably the water bottle holder works perfectly). I use the bag nearly every day in this capacity and have never had a problem with it. 

When it s time to travel the bag fills that role wonderfully as well. As I travel for business all the features focused on the business traveller get to shine. The laptop sleeve is great, the area for storing pens and supplies is well thought out, and the shoe pocket allows me to bring casual and business shoes where ever I go. 

The inside capacity of the bag is enormous regardless of my use as gym bag or travel bag. Construction is great and I’ve had numerous friends ask about the bag, with one using the phone on his camera to take a picture or the logo last night because he was so impressed by the brand that he wanted to look into getting one.
review.name: Great multipurpose bag

name: Travel Bag 40L

review.reviewBody: I love the fabric and the extra compression sections of it. I found the legs to fit well but the waistband was pretty loose. I am 5'2 130 lbs and I ordered a Medium. I will be reordering a small.

review.reviewBody: The material is very non stretchy.. like difficult to put on.. but once on they give adequate compression, less then expected for the effort to get them on. I like the seam feel, but not sure if it’s as good as the traditional pants I typically buy from here. Size wise was pretty accurate actually slightly bigger then expected fit,
review.name: No seam is nice

review.reviewBody: Pants are extremely soft. They are an average fit. Purchased the entire outfit, tee shirt, long sleeve shirt & pants!!!
review.name: Most comfortable pants

review.reviewBody: I have a run in them already before I even moved
comment: We highly appreciate the honest feedback on the material and quality of your gear, as we will be sure to take a closer look!

review.reviewBody: No seam is more comfortable for me in leggings. It hugs all my curves and accentuates my legs and bottom.
review.name: No seam

review.reviewBody: I love these leggings so much I bought another pair.  They are very comfortable and I love the design.
review.name: Great compression leggings

review.reviewBody: Great for working out and relaxing around the house highly recommend
review.name: Great for working out

review.reviewBody: These leggings are really comfortable. The only issue I’ve had is the roll down in the front when I bend down.
review.name: Super comfortable

review.reviewBody:
I love love love these pants. I’m 6’ tall and for years was a fan of another company. I’ve been struggling for the past couple years as I’ve found the quality of my past loved leggings has diminished.
I tried these on and instantly fell in love with them. I love the fit: length, softness, stretch, and overall quality. My new favourite legging. I bought 3 pairs! :)
review.name: Love the fit and feel

review.reviewBody: Keen makes some of the best footwear you can buy. I can't recommend their products enough. Although they are more expensive, they are well worth the extra money. I have found that my Keen sandals will last for years. I bought an off brand this summer, and they lasted 4 months. Don't throw your money away on cheap sandals, in the long run they will cost you 10x as much.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: Probably perfect with socks, but initial wearing on dirt trail, no socks, not quite snug enough, or possibly 1/2 size too big. Will keep, however, and adjust size on next order. Cool, comfy, good support wearing around camp and on easy trails.
review.name: Roomy

review.reviewBody: I am 73 years old will be 74 this year used to hike fish irrigate in northern New Mexico for years. I had a real bad round of sciatica. My feet were messed up. My hips were messed up. I wore a pair of these out years ago, decided to try a new parent and see what would happ happen I absolutely love them. You guys have always had great products. I've worn lots of them out in my lifetime. Keep it up. Ray Trotter Taos, New Mexico
review.name: Save my life

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my 2nd pair of Arroyos and they are simply my favorite shoes. Light weight and very well made. The sole supports provide a solid feel and firmness for climbing and rough scrambling while at the same time offering real comfort and good looks for almost any activity.
review.name: Great Light Weight All Purpose Shoes

review.reviewBody: Good for my feet but wish the lace clip held better (long a problem with Arroyo II) and wish that the plastic in the back wouldn’t break down so readily. I buy these because I can use my own footer insert.
review.name: Good for my feet but

review.reviewBody:
If you are looking for a waterproof rigged shoe, but yet comfortable, for outdoor activity, this is it. I needed a shoe that was something a little more protective than sandals, yet not as restrictive as regular shoes. Found them. 

Warning. im my opinion, they run about 1/2 a size larger. I’m regularly size 11. So I ended up buying another pair in size 10.5.
review.name: Awesome hybrid shoe/sandal.

review.reviewBody: My husband absolutely loves this sandal shoe. It's all he wears around the house and for lounging. It's very comfortable, it's made very well and lasts forever. The quick laces are great too.
review.name: PERFECT SANDAL SHOE EVER

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Being an old guy who needs supportive footwear that lets me stay active, I bought these to replace 10-year old Tevas. I needed closed-toe/heel sandals to launch my sailing dinghy and traipse in the woods with my dog, and these are a great fit. Nearly all of my footwear is Keens, and these do not disappoint.
review.name: Best supportive summer sandal

review.reviewBody: Heavy clunky footwear. Should be good for rough terrain but heavy soled. Runs bigger than other Keens I’ve purchased in the past.
review.name: Heavy

review.reviewBody: Was very disappointed in how difficult it was to return…they are too big and wound like to return please
review.name: Need to return

name: Arroyo II Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent quality compression bag. I used the 20L to pack my -40 TNF inferno sleeping bag.
review.name: Excellent quality

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these stuff sacks for backpacking in unpredictable weather. Knowing that my sleep system is dry and ready for me when I need it after a long hike is priceless. 
I use these for my essential clothing too - puffy, sleep long underwear. Just need to keep those pieces dry and this bag does it.
review.name: Dry, Compact and functional

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the Stainless Steel pots. Work great on induction & gas burners
review.name: Great SS pots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This might be the perfect bag, well designed in every detail. It’s lightweight, with 2 buckles the straps don’t get tangled, and the E-vent fabric lets out the air you couldn’t quite squeeze out the top. Highly recommend
review.name: Everything I wanted in a compression sack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like this bag but it’s difficult to get the air out (probably what makes it so waterproof) and the main clip sticks. I need something to grip it to unlock. Overall good purchase but that clip will keep me from using it in my thru hike.
review.name: Great bag just watch out for clips.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I own multiple, there are reasons why i own multiple
review.name: Bestive found considering the weight

review.reviewBody:
The 8L bag fits my 20degree down sleeping bag with plenty of room left. Easily makes my sleeping bag 40% smaller than the stuff sack it came with. This will free up a good amount of space in my pack that I can use for other things, and gives another layer of waterproofing for the most important piece of gear. This should also fit in most bike panniers just fine, fits in mine. 
It can be a bit difficult to push air out of the sack but just be patient it does work.
review.name: More space in my pack now

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] fit my sleeping bag and my puffy set perfectly in the 13L bags i own one of every size. I would 100% recommend these.

review.reviewBody: I really like this jacket. At 5'8 and 160 with broad shoulders and the Large fits very nicely, with room for a light fleece or heavy wool underneath. The sleeves however, are about 4 inches short when I bend my elbow. I'd prefer the sleeves to be 5-6 inches longer, so I might hide my hands inside during a good rain. As is, I'll have to roll the sleeves of my clothing up so they don't get wet. I'll keep it though, as the sale price was incredible.
review.name: short sleeves

review.reviewBody: For the price, the features and quality are terrific--it's an ideal jacket for warm or cool weather.  At 5'7" 30#, a medium leaves enough room for a light sweater or for some air flow in warmer temps.
review.name: Almost-Perfect Lightweight Rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this to replace another, lighter shell and was nervous about the added weight but it ended up being an upgrade. It kept me dry in 3 hours of rain and hail without wetting through, and consistently kept the wind out. Not the lightest option on the market, but the lightest is flimsy and wets out quickly. I recommend this jacket if you're looking for a durable rain shell!
review.name: Kept me dry in rain and hail

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a lightweight jacket that I could travel with and layer over warmer clothes and this is the trick!
review.name: Perfect lightweight rain jacket

review.reviewBody: This rain jacket is seriously my favorite fall item! Great for layering under the coat. Repels water so well while still being ver durable. I have a dog who loves to rough play with some sharp teeth and nails. This jacket has withstood 3 years so far and I expect many more! Couldn’t recommend this more.
review.name: best light weight rain jacket

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, great fit, comfortable and stays dry even through long downpours. Great for backpacking and long treks in the backcountry.

Lightweight and durable. My only complaint is that, while the hood is great for accommodating helmets and ponytails, there is not an adjustment for when you want to wear the hood without a helmet. You can tighten the opening, but I would love to also be able to pull the hood back and Velcro it so that my hoodie doesn't cover up my eyes when in use. Granted I have a smaller than average head, but I imagine this would still be an issue with people with average sized heads.
review.name: Solid jacket

review.reviewBody: Outdoors in the Pacific NW inevitably involves rain. I find this jacket very water proof whether hiking in the mountains or walking around the neighborhood. It's a good outer layer on soggy days, and very packable. A great piece of gear, that can be appreciated by novice and expert alike.  Highly functional and beautiful too! Whether headed for a summer hike, or winter xc-skiing, pack this a long as a waterproof top layer (or single layer).
review.name: Great piece

name: Treeline Rain Shell - Women's
